Social first, media second: 

The moment I stopped becoming sales focused on social media was also the moment I started selling books. 

Readers want to connect with authors on some kind of personal or conversational way.

We basically work for pennies a year. Even a good publishing agency may pay 10% royalty. So that 3 dollar book earns the writer less than 30 cents because Amazon, Barnes and Noble, and an agency also get royalties up to 15% each. The hours we spend is insanity to most.

if you can afford this you can afford a book. https://t.co/IN6WppW7R0 #readersoftwitter #writerscommunity. Please don't drive thru a @Starbucks or any coffee kiosk & say you can't afford a 3 dollar book. Castle Syndrome is believing writers are rich. A few? maybe. Most, not even.
